subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Liquidation Preferences: Who Gets Paid First
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Liquidation Preferences: Who Gets Paid First.

hook.text: A startup sells for $20M. The founder owns 60%. They get $0. How? Liquidation preferences.

buildup.text: Liquidation preference means investors get their money back before anyone else in an exit.

discovery.text: A 1x preference is standard: investors get back what they put in, then share the rest.

twist.text: A 2x or 3x preference means investors double or triple their money before founders see a dime.

climax.text: In a down exit, stacked preferences can wipe out founders and employees entirely.

punchline.text: Ownership percentage means nothing if someone else gets paid first.

quiz.question: What is a liquidation preference?
options: A term that ensures investors get their money back before other shareholders in an exit
A founder's right to liquidate company assets
The order in which company debts are paid off
